name: hot rolling, steel | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22687/documentation

This dataset describes the hot rolling of steel in Austria. The data are based on an Austrian company which produces reinforcing steel including the hot rolling process. Since the steel billets are produced on site, they are generally still hot when entering the hot rolling process, only a small share of the billets have to be reheated. This increases the energy efficiency of the hot rolling. The steel production is not included in this dataset.;There are two co-products that are used in other industries: Scale (material formed through oxidation of the cooling billet) can be used in steel production, cement production, and refractory production. Heat is used in the communal district heating grid.

This process starts with the arrival of steel billets. 

Hot rolling steel into rebars or coils. Bending is not included in this dataset.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/241:Manufacture of basic iron and steel/2410:Manufacture of basic iron and steel

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The process is expected to be valid for the next 10 years. The energy efficiency and emissions may improve in the next years.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data-set is representative for European Union
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The hot rolling process descibes the production of rebars and coils for reinforcing steel from steel billets. Rebars have a diameter of 8-40mm and a length of 6-30m. Coils have a diameter of 8-16mm and weigh 1.7, 3.0 or 5.0. The average steel grade is B550 or B500 (550 or 500 MPa).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: In case the company did not provide accurate data, data from the dataset "hot rolling, steel [RER]" were used.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data was provided directly by the steel production company. For the year 2017, the input material flows were given in absolute numbers and per ton of produced steel.

exchanges.description: Measured Value. Heat (low temperature) is used in the communal district heating grid.

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on measured values

Measured Value. During the cooling of the steel, there is a material loss through oxidation at the surface. This material loss is called scale. Scale is first stored and then sold. It can be used in steel production, cement production, and refractory production.
